Rita Chen
Background

I hold a Bachelor's degree in Landscape Architecture. Currently, I am broadening my horizons by pursuing a Master of Applied Computing at Lincoln University. My exploration of the IT field has enhanced my understanding of technology and future trends, fostering a curiosity and eagerness to learn about new developments. This interdisciplinary journey has equipped me with a unique blend of creative and technical skills, allowing me to approach problems with both artistic insight and logical analysis.

In my landscape journey, I have gained experience across China and New Zealand, which has enriched me with a diverse array of challenges. These experiences have shaped both my creative and practical abilities, enhancing my deep understanding of the landscape industry.

While learning about IT, I developed a particular interest in front-end development and databases, which allows me to combine my design background with technical together.

Landscape Skills
  • AutoCAD
  • Revit: Knowledgeable in Revit
  • Adobe Suite (Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe InDesign)
  • Sketch Up & Lumion: Modelling and Rendering
  • ArcGIS: Analysis of site condition
  • Landscape Design: Understanding of landscape design princples and Te Aranga Maori design principles
IT Skills
  • Programming Languages: Python, JavaScript, and SQL
  • Web Development: HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, Flask and Jinja
  • Database Management: MySQL
  • Cloud Computing: Knowledgeable in Azure
Interpersonal Skills
  • Teamwork: As a team player, adept at providing support and building strong collaborative relationships with teams. Possessing problem-solving abilities and adaptability, I thrive in diverse work environments and under various challenges, maintaining stability and efficiency.


  • Communication: Strong communication skills, proactively engaging with teams, valuing their insights and perspectives, and ensuring that we synergize our efforts effectively towards shared objectives.


  • Problem Solving: Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, able to analyze problems from different angles and formulate solutions for discussion and collaboration with the team.


  • Time Management: As the saying goes, "If you fail to plan, then plan to fail." I prioritize tasks according to their due dates and the priorities set by the product owner. I also allocate spare time to review projects to ensure they are finished on time and functioning properly. Effective time management not only ensures timely completion of tasks but also helps me cope with stress and perform well under pressure.
Landscape Architect - Contractor

Key achievements and responsibilities:

  • Contributing to visual communication efforts, including site plans and perspectives.
  • Collaborating closely with contractors and the team to ensure the success of projects.
  • Assisting in site visits and providing construction administration support as required.
